quotes: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. - Steve Jobs
Code is poetry written in a language computers understand. - Unknown
Perfect is the enemy of good. - Voltaire
First, solve the problem. Then, write the code. - John Johnson
Debugging is like being the detective in a crime drama. - Filipe Fortes
Any fool can write code. The art is writing code that humans can understand. - Martin Fowler
The most effective debugging tool is still careful thought. - Brian W. Kernighan
Premature optimization is the root of all evil. - Donald Knuth
Make it work, make it right, make it fast. - Kent Beck
Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication. - Leonardo da Vinci
Don't reinvent the wheel. - Common wisdom
Keep it simple, stupid. - KISS Principle
Write code as if the next person to read it is a serial killer. - Unknown
Bad code ruins everything. Good code makes everything possible. - Unknown
You are not your code. Don't take it personally. - Unknown
Code reviews are conversations. - Unknown
The best code is the code you don't have to write. - Unknown
Function names should tell you why they exist and what they do. - Robert Martin
Don't comment bad code—rewrite it. - Brian W. Kernighan
Measure twice, code once. - Unknown
Every expert was once a beginner. - Unknown
Clean code always looks like it was written by someone who cares. - Robert C. Martin
The real problem is that programmers have spent far too much time worrying about efficiency. - Donald Knuth
techTips: Use version control for everything. Git is your friend!
Write tests before you write code (TDD). It saves time!
Comment your why, not your what. Code shows what, comments show why!
Keep functions small and focused on one thing!
Refactor regularly to keep your codebase healthy!
Learn your IDE shortcuts—it will save hours!
Use meaningful variable names that describe their purpose!
Review other people's code to learn new techniques!
Use linters to catch bugs before runtime!
Performance matters, but readable code matters more!
Always handle edge cases and errors gracefully!
Stay curious and keep learning new technologies!
Break complex problems into smaller, manageable pieces.
Use consistent naming conventions across your codebase.
Write code for humans first, computers second.
